report.title: Experience and Physical Withdrawal Effects
report.author: Dora the Explorer
report.bodytext: At one point in my life I was taking 6-8mg of Xanax daily for nearly a month. This was partly a psychological addiction on my part, but what I want to focus on is the physical withdrawal symptoms. Withdrawal for me involved, no sleep, nightmares, constant nausea, pain, mental agony, major sinus problems. In other words, a living hell. /n /n Would I do this drug again? Yes, but I will never get physically addicted again. Even though I had the mental strength to stop, it is so incredibly painful and dangerous I would not repeat it ever. /n /n Experience at 6mg: /n T+0:00 /n Pop 3 2mg pills. /n /n T+0:30 /n Feel very 'out-of-it', drunken euphoria, little nausea, all cares and worries go away. /n /n T+1:00 /n Get hungry, my sinuses are cleared up, I like just hanging out watching TV. /n /n T+1:30 /n My ability to store memories is practically gone. I have no inhabitations. I fall off a bike and cut myself, but am completely numb to pain. /n /n T+2:00 /n It's a fairly sedate and restful feeling also. The feeling is not euphoria per say, but a permeating numbness.
